intro: Ageratina pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and are arranged in compact clusters. Ageratina pauciflora is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid conditions.
